bibl.title: Collecting Fragments Today: What Status Will a Fragment Have in the Era of Digital Philology?
bibl.note: La contribution figure exclusivement dans la version électronique de l'ouvrage, non dans la version imprimée. - See in part. pp. 416-420: What is a fragment? [""There is a fairly sharp distinction between fragments which became fragments accidentally, for instance inscriptions or papyri, and other pieces where the reasons for their fragmentary state are more diversified.""] - Avec résumé en anglais.

bibl.title: Lire demain. Des manuscrits antiques à l'ère digitale - Reading Tomorrow. From Ancient Manuscripts to the Digital Era.

bibl.seg: Alexandra Trachsel, Collecting Fragments Today: What Status Will a Fragment Have in the Era of Digital Philology?

Claire Clivaz, Jérôme Meizoz, François Vallotton & Joseph Verheyden (edd.), avec la collaboration de Benjamin Bertho, Lire demain. Des manuscrits antiques à l'ère digitale - Reading Tomorrow. From Ancient Manuscripts to the Digital Era (Lausanne, 2012) pp. 415-429; - xxvii.

La contribution figure exclusivement dans la version électronique de l'ouvrage, non dans la version imprimée. - See in part. pp. 416-420: What is a fragment? [""There is a fairly sharp distinction between fragments which became fragments accidentally, for instance inscriptions or papyri, and other pieces where the reasons for their fragmentary state are more diversified.""] - Avec résumé en anglais.
